page.title: 01STENIGOT
page.content: Stenigot parish forms part of the well farmed and immaculate Stenigot estate. Soils - heavy clay, blowing sand, loam chalk, crops - peas, potatoes, sugar beet, vegetables, oil seed rape. 1000 mule ewes produce fat lambs. Mrs. Peter Dennis'a Stenigot show pony stud is renowned. The care of old woodlands and the planting of many coverts has added greatly to the landscape - to sport and wildlife. Two irrigation lakes encorage Mallard, Pochard, Tufted Ducks etc. Conservation and the general quality of country life given a high priority also standards of profitable farming. Sixteen cottages all occupied by estate workers - all centrally heated - mains electricity and water. Stenigot House - residence of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Dennis - estate owners. School buses collect children for Donington Primary and Louth
